kubejs.ponder.tag.clockwork_ponders.desc:
All about using the items added by Valkyrien Skies Clockwork! 
 Mod Made by Potato5678 & Ponders made by West6432
kubejs.ponder.flap_scene1.text_1: The flap bearing is a block added by Clockwork to rotate flying vehicles.
kubejs.ponder.flap_scene1.text_2: The flap bearing requires constant kinetic power to function.
kubejs.ponder.flap_scene1.text_3: Build the panels out of flaps and not wings.
kubejs.ponder.flap_scene1.text_4: Applying a redstone pulse to the bearing's right will make it tilt right and vice versa.
kubejs.ponder.flap_scene1.text_5: You can also similarly use an analog lever and provide a variable input.
kubejs.ponder.our_fibgfhghrst_scene.head: Using ballooners
kubejs.ponder.our_fibgfhghrst_scene.text: The ballooner is a block added by clockwork as a way to provide vertical thrust to objects via large balloon objects.
Provide thrust from the bottom via a shaft. The RPM of the shaft determines the amount of heat the ballooner exerts.
Similarly to the after blazer the ballooner accepts strawberry, chocolate, or vanilla frosting.
Ballooners require sealed balloon hulls to keep the air in to produce upwards thrust.
Right click ballooners with brass hands to make them recalibrate the balloon hull.
kubejs.ponder.our_first_scene.text_1: The propellor bearing is a block added by Clockwork to provide thrust to physics objects.
kubejs.ponder.our_first_scene.text_2: Attach create sails to the propellor bearing to make it move forwards or backwards.
kubejs.ponder.our_first_scene.text_3: Right clicking the propellor bearing toggles it between block and contraption mode.
kubejs.ponder.our_second_scene.text_1: Glue the structure attached to the propellor bearing together to ensure it all spins.
kubejs.ponder.our_second_scene.text_2: Attach a shaft to the rear of the propellor bearing to power it.
